repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Provincial Irrigated
            Agriculture Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project has been
            rated mostly satisfactory achieving most of its major
            objectives. Overall, the economic rate of return (ERR) has
            been re-estimated at 14.2 percent, compared to 17.5 percent
            at appraisal, obscuring the social and cultural setting,
            structure and performance of a number of independent
            irrigation schemes. Half the schemes, in close to
            three-quarters of the project area, are generating good to
            excellent rates of return, while an equal number of schemes
            in one quarter area, only generate marginal to poor rates of
            return. Thus, a number of key lessons were provided: 1)
            Complex and centrally managed projects can be successfully
            implemented through coordination at lower levels of
            government, where an inter-disciplinary design would
            encourage cooperation; 2) A sustained integrated approach to
            implementation may be established through the supervision
            support from the Bank Resident Mission; 3) Comparative
            profitability should be considered as a selection criterion;
            4) Future project design should be adaptable and area
            specific; 5) The need for developing capacity of local
            consultants/contractors was specified; 6) Improvement of
            operation and maintenance is required; and 7) Settlement
            activities should not have been part of the project.

5079048.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
5079048.theme: Rural markets,Land administration and management,Rural services and infrastructure
5079048.trustfund:
TF036129-INDONESIA - PROVINCIAL
            IRRIGATION AGRICULTURE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
5079048.majtheme: Rural development,Environment and natural resource management

repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Provincial Irrigated
            Agriculture Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The main project objective is to achieve
            potential benefits from irrigated agricultural development
            by completing and fully developing ongoing small and medium
            scale irrigation schemes in 13 provinces on the Outer
            Islands of Indonesia.  A related objective is to assist
            development of institutional capacity to enable improved
            coordination of irrigation with agriculture and other
            related services.  To meet the above objectives, the project
            will comprise:  (a) a survey, investigations and design; (b)
            completion of irrigation works on some 130 schemes serving
            about 273,000 ha, including construction of minor canal and
            drainage systems and preparation for operation and
            maintenance (PROM); (c) land clearance and development of
            about 40,000 ha; (d) agricultural development activities
            including seed multiplication programs, trials for problem
            soils and training of farmer groups; (e) land titling and
            certification; (f) environmental protection, including
            forest surveys and erosion control; (g) settlement; and (h)
            coordination and management of irrigated agricultural development.
